SEARCH
Package gw.api.databuilder

Class PaymentBuilder

java.lang.Object
gw.api.databuilder.DataBuilder<Payment,PaymentBuilder>
gw.api.databuilder.CCDataBuilder<Payment,PaymentBuilder>
gw.api.databuilder.TransactionBuilder<Payment,PaymentBuilder>
gw.api.databuilder.PaymentBuilder
All Implemented Interfaces:
DelegateDataBuilder<Payment>, ValueGenerator<Payment>
public class PaymentBuilder extends TransactionBuilder<Payment,PaymentBuilder>
Builder to create Payment transaction entities.

Notes:

  • To set the Amount of the transaction, use withLineItem().
  • You must call withStatus() to set the Status on the transaction. When create() is called, this method sets up the Taccounts for the transaction given its status and other fields.

  • Method Details

    • uiReadyPayment

      public static PaymentBuilder uiReadyPayment(ValueGenerator<? extends Claim> claim, Check check, CurrencyAmount amount)
      Returns a PaymentBuilder for creating a check with a single line item in AWAITINGSUBMISSION state, on an approved checkset. It will have costtype and costcategory set but there is no guarantee what values these fields will have; it is recommended to explicitly specify values for both fields (using withCostType() and withCostCategory()). Note that the containing checkset will contain only this payment. If you want to commit a checkset with multiple check transactions, you will have to create a separate CheckSetBuilder and link CheckBuilders to it.
      Parameters:
      claim - the claim the created payment should be coded to
      check - the check that the payment should be associated with
      amount - the amount of the (single) line item on the created payment
      Returns:
      a UI-ready PaymentBuilder, with the specified properties and TransactionStatus of AWAITINGSUBMISSION

    • uiReadyPayment

      public static PaymentBuilder uiReadyPayment(Claim claim, Check check, CurrencyAmount amount)
      Variant of uiReadyPayment that takes a claim entity instead of a builder.

    • withCloseClaim

      public PaymentBuilder withCloseClaim(boolean closeClaim)
      Sets the CloseClaim field. If this transaction is a Final payment, this property indicates whether it should or did close its associated claim.
      Parameters:
      closeClaim - the desired value
      Returns:
      the modified builder

    • withCloseExposure

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the modified builder

    • withDoesNotErodeReserves

      public PaymentBuilder withDoesNotErodeReserves(boolean doesNotErodeReserves)
      Sets the indicates whether this payment should not erode reserves for its ReserveLine. This field can only be set if it is exposed in the UI. Otherwise, one of the setAsEroding() or setAsNonEroding() methods must be called from a rule to change whether a payment erodes reserves.
      Parameters:
      doesNotErodeReserves - the desired value
      Returns:
      the modified builder
